author: andschwa
body: More duplicated effort happened on the Source Depot side of things unfortunately, but this should stop in about a month or so. Fortunately, those were also the only conflicts, and so were very easily resolved.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
Note that this does _not_ contain regenerated resource files, so if those changed extensively, that will also need to be done.

It does not _appear_ that any source file dependencies changed, as this still built and passed tests on my Linux machine, but that should be double checked.

This brings in the necessary code to start building the Windows managed host for #495, but due to the all the native P/Invokes, it'll still require quite a bit of porting. However, with @lzybkr's forthcoming updates to use VT1000, this may end up being much easier.

/cc @vors

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
@PowerShell/linux This is now holding up other work, I must merge.

/cc @paulcallen

comments.author: paulcallen
comments.body: good to go as validation builds are done

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Will ff merge immediately after. Required monad PR is merged.

title: Bump monad with merge from Source Depot
